not tracked not covered covered 
package dumpservice

import (
        "fmt"
        "net"
        "net/http"
        "time"

        "io"
        "os"

        "github.com/Sirupsen/logrus"
        "github.com/gorilla/mux"
        "github.com/signalfuse/sfxinternalgo/sbingest/tsidcache/tsiddiskcache"
        "github.com/signalfx/golib/disco"
        "github.com/signalfx/golib/distconf"
        "github.com/signalfx/golib/logherd"
)

var dbDumpServiceName = "ondisk-tsidcache"

var log *logrus.Logger

func init() {
        log = logherd.New()
}

// DumpDBServiceConfig configures what port the database dump server listens to
type DumpDBServiceConfig struct {
        DumpPort int64
}

// Load the server config values from distconf
func (c *DumpDBServiceConfig) Load(d *distconf.Config) {
        c.DumpPort = d.Int("sbingest.dumpdb.port", 6061).Get()
}

// DumpDBService allows other sbingest servers to copy this server's on disk cache
type DumpDBService struct {
        debugServer       *http.Server
        debugHTTPListener net.Listener
        disk              *tsiddiskcache.DiskCache
        warmer            Warmer
}

// Warmer is called by the warmdb HTTP endpoint
type Warmer interface {
        Warm() error
}

// NewDumpDBService creates a new listener for server on disk files
func NewDumpDBService(conf *DumpDBServiceConfig, disk *tsiddiskcache.DiskCache, disc *disco.Disco, warmer Warmer) (*DumpDBService, error) {
        listenAddr := fmt.Sprintf(":%d", conf.DumpPort)
        clientTimeout := time.Minute * 45
        listener, err := net.Listen("tcp", listenAddr)
        if err != nil {
                return nil, err
        }
        dumpListener := listener
        handler := mux.NewRouter()
        handler.Path("/dumpdb").HandlerFunc(disk.BackupHandler)

        dumpServer := &http.Server{
                Handler:      handler,
                Addr:         listenAddr,
                ReadTimeout:  clientTimeout,
                WriteTimeout: clientTimeout,
        }
        ret := &DumpDBService{
                debugServer:       dumpServer,
                debugHTTPListener: dumpListener,
                disk:              disk,
                warmer:            warmer,
        }
        handler.Path("/warmdb").HandlerFunc(ret.beginWarm)
        go dumpServer.Serve(dumpListener)
        disc.Advertise(dbDumpServiceName, struct{}{}, uint16(conf.DumpPort))
        return ret, nil
}

func (d *DumpDBService) beginWarm(w http.ResponseWriter, req *http.Request) {
        err := d.warmer.Warm()
        if err == nil {
                w.Write([]byte(`Write OK`))
                return
        }
        w.WriteHeader(http.StatusServiceUnavailable)
        w.Write([]byte(err.Error()))
}

// Close stops the listening server
func (d *DumpDBService) Close() error {
        return d.debugHTTPListener.Close()
}

// UpdateConfig controls how far back we consider a disk file still valid
type UpdateConfig struct {
        BadDiskTimeout   time.Duration
        SkipDiskDownload int64
}

// Load the update config from distconf
func (c *UpdateConfig) Load(d *distconf.Config) {
        c.BadDiskTimeout = d.Duration("tsidcache.coldrewarm", time.Hour).Get()
        c.SkipDiskDownload = d.Int("tsidcache.skip_download", 0).Get()
}

// UpdateDiskIfNeeded will open the on disk tsid file and update it with another in disco if it
// is too old
func UpdateDiskIfNeeded(diskConfig *tsiddiskcache.DiskCacheConfig, conf *UpdateConfig, disc *disco.Disco, now time.Time) error {
        log.WithField("conf", conf).Info("UpdateDiskIfNeeded() -> ")
        defer log.Info("<- UpdateDiskIfNeeded()")
        if conf.SkipDiskDownload != 0 {
                log.Info("Skipping download from another host.  Config set")
                return nil
        }
        lastValidTime, err := func() (time.Time, error) {
                configToUse := *diskConfig
                configToUse.VerifyOnLoad = false
                disk, err := tsiddiskcache.NewDiskCache(&configToUse, nil)
                if err != nil {
                        return time.Time{}, err
                }
                defer disk.Close()
                return disk.ValidAtTimestamp()
        }()
        if err == nil && lastValidTime.Add(conf.BadDiskTimeout).After(now) {
                log.Info("Not fetching another valid version from cluster.  On disk cache valid enough")
                return nil
        }
        serv, err := disc.Services(dbDumpServiceName)
        if err != nil {
                return err
        }
        instances := serv.ServiceInstances()
        dialStrings := make([]string, 0, len(instances))
        for _, instance := range instances {
                log.WithField("instance", instance).Info("Looking up dial string")
                dialStrings = append(dialStrings, instance.DialString())
        }
        log.Infof("Dial strings: %s", dialStrings)
        bestDialString := bestDialString(dialStrings, now, conf.BadDiskTimeout)
        log.Infof("Best dial string: %s", bestDialString)
        if bestDialString == "" {
                log.Warn("Unable to find a valid instance in the tier.  Will have to warm from ES")
                return nil
        }
        return updateDiskFromHTTP(diskConfig.FullFilepath(), bestDialString, time.Minute*3)
}

func bestDialString(dialStrings []string, now time.Time, badDiskDuration time.Duration) string {
        bestModified := now.Add(-badDiskDuration).Add(-time.Second).UTC()
        bestDialString := ""
        for _, dialStringPart := range dialStrings {
                thisDialString := fmt.Sprintf("http://%s/dumpdb", dialStringPart)
                resp, err := http.Head(thisDialString)
                if err != nil {
                        log.Warnf("Unable to do HEAD request to %s", thisDialString)
                        continue
                }
                lastModified, err := time.Parse(http.TimeFormat, resp.Header.Get("Last-Modified"))
                if err != nil {
                        log.Warnf("Unable to get a valid database header from %s", thisDialString)
                        continue
                }
                lastModified = lastModified.UTC()
                if lastModified.After(bestModified) {
                        bestDialString = thisDialString
                        bestModified = lastModified
                }
        }
        return bestDialString
}

func updateDiskFromHTTP(diskPath string, dialString string, timeout time.Duration) error {
        log.Infof("Update disk from HTTP called for dial string: %s", dialString)
        fileObj, err := os.Create(diskPath)
        if err != nil {
                return err
        }
        defer fileObj.Close()
        client := http.Client{
                Timeout:   timeout,
                Transport: &http.Transport{},
        }
        log.Info("Starting update fetch")
        resp, err := client.Get(dialString)
        if err != nil {
                log.Errorf("%s", err)
                return err
        }
        defer resp.Body.Close()
        if resp.StatusCode != 200 {
                log.Info("Bad code?")
                return fmt.Errorf("invalid status code: %d", resp.StatusCode)
        }
        log.Info("status ok")
        written, err := io.Copy(fileObj, resp.Body)
        log.Infof("Wrote %d bytes from another cache", written)
        return err
}
